summary: Completed comprehensive testing of CodeGuardian AI delete functionality and auto-fix visibility. Backend APIs are working correctly (6/7 tests passed), but identified a critical frontend issue with Issues tab display.

critical_bugs.issue: Issues tab not displaying individual issues despite having issue data
critical_bugs.description: DataScienceCapstone analysis shows '14 issues found' in Overview tab but Issues tab shows no issue cards. The data exists but is not being rendered properly.
critical_bugs.impact: Users cannot view detailed issue information, making the analysis incomplete

passed_tests: Delete analysis functionality - delete buttons work correctly and remove analyses from list
Auto-fix visibility - Auto-fixes tab displays properly with 'No automatic fixes were applied' message
Analysis history display - analyses are properly loaded and displayed with correct metadata
View analysis details - View button successfully opens detailed analysis view
Current analysis close button - X button properly closes current analysis view
Backend API endpoints - GET /api/analyses and DELETE /api/analysis/{id} working correctly
Analysis tabs navigation - Overview, Auto-Fixes, and AI Summary tabs all functional
Analysis statistics display - Overview tab shows correct file count, issue count, and fix count
AI Summary functionality - displays meaningful analysis content

success_percentage.frontend: 90% (9/10 major features working, 1 critical issue with Issues tab display)

action_item_for_E1: Fix Issues tab rendering - the frontend is not displaying individual issues in the Issues tab despite having the data (confirmed by Overview stats showing '14 issues found'). The issue appears to be in the React component rendering logic for the Issues tab content. Check the groupIssuesByType function and the Issues tab rendering in App.js.
